page.title: 12Sheep In The Wylye Valley
page.content: Sheep are very important in the valley.The farmers start lambing at the beginning of February.They mark the lambs with plastic tags as they are born and when they are about six weeks old they are tatooed on their ears.{The}tails have to be docked as they collect a lot of dirt and then attract the blow fly which will lay eggs that become maggots and eat the flesh of the sheep.The tails are removed by using a special rubber band that stops the blood.{In}May/June they shear the sheep.They send the wool to the wool marketing board.{In } July and October by law they dip the sheep to prevent sheep scab and deter the blow fly.{Some}sheep are shown and have to be washed and brushed and trained to be led quietly. {Sheep}grazing in the valley are a familiar and lovely sight.
